description.narrative: Mainstreaming coastal and marine biodiversity conservation into production sectors in the Sindhudurg Coast, Maharashtra.
populated place
populated place
populated place
Crosssectoral planning framework that mainstreams biodiversity conservation considerations

Establishing a functional crosssectoral Stakeholder Committee for the management of SCME involving District Planning Dept Forest Dept the Maritime Board Dept of Industries Fisheries Agriculture Tourism Private Sector NGOs

comment.narrative:
Cross sectoral stakeholder committee constituted vide Go No WLP1009CR171 Dated 20 August 2013
Three meeting conducted during from 20142015 which is listed below
1 30th July 2014
2 12th January 2015
3 5th May 2015

Cross sectoral stakeholder committee constituted vide Go No WLP1009CR171 Dated 20 August 2013
Three meeting conducted during from 20142015 which is listed below

2 12th January 2015
3 5th May 2015

description.narrative: Financial sustainability strategy for continued implementation of landscapelevel management of SCME

comment.narrative: The Draft Proposal for formation of the Sindhudurg Foundation has been prepared by LLPMU and submitted to the CSSCC and circulated to the members for comments
The Draft Proposal for formation of the Sindhudurg Foundation has been prepared by LLPMU and submitted to the CSSCC and circulated to the members for comments

description.narrative: Landscape level zoning plan LP that zones resource use by taking into account conservation needs of the SCME

comment.narrative: 1 Landscape Plan that prepared and integrated with the District level planning process

EOIs have been floated thrice and no suitable agencies could be shortlisted This is because landscape level plans for coastal and marine biodiversity conservation is a relatively new concept in India and there is limited or no precedent of such initiatives New strategies for identifying agencies are being worked out through a consultative process This matter has been taken up to NPSC and SPSC
Cross Sectoral Stakeholder Consultation Committee CSSCC formation has already taken place
1 Landscape Plan that prepared and integrated with the District level planning process

EOIs have been floated thrice and no suitable agencies could be shortlisted This is because landscape level plans for coastal and marine biodiversity conservation is a relatively new concept in India and there is limited or no precedent of such initiatives New strategies for identifying agencies are being worked out through a consultative process This matter has been taken up to NPSC and SPSC
Cross Sectoral Stakeholder Consultation Committee CSSCC formation has already taken place

description.narrative: Zoning of MMS in line with LP

comment.narrative: Current MMS boundaries do not capture key biodiversity rich areas and there is conflict with local fishermen on resource use issues
MMS boundaries and zoning are rationalized to accord protection to biodiversity rich areas and to guarantee occupational interests and innocent passage of local fishers

Several studies for profiling the key biodiversity elements of the SCME covering Corals Associated flora fauna Cetaceans Avifauna Mangroves Turtles etc have been initiated The outcome of these studies wills assist in rationalizing the boundaries and Zoning of MMS 2 Several meetings have been conducted for discussion with the local communities After setting up of the interpretation centre and the Foundation the issues relating to the rationalizing of MMS will be taken up
MMS boundaries and zoning are rationalized to accord protection to biodiversity rich areas and to guarantee occupational interests and innocent passage of local fishers

Several studies for profiling the key biodiversity elements of the SCME covering Corals Associated flora fauna Cetaceans Avifauna Mangroves Turtles etc have been initiated The outcome of these studies wills assist in rationalizing the boundaries and Zoning of MMS 2 Several meetings have been conducted for discussion with the local communities After setting up of the interpretation centre and the Foundation the issues relating to the rationalizing of MMS will be taken up

description.narrative: Recommendations on reform of MFRA

comment.narrative: MFRA does not adequately incorporate the integration of the conservation of coastal and marine biodiversity
Amendments to MFRA incorporating provisions for the conservation of coastal and marine biodiversity approved or under consideration by State Department of Agriculture Fisheries

The Commissioner of Fisheries Government of Maharashtra has made it mandatory to use square mesh at cod end of Trawl nets
Restriction of vessel size CPUE is under consideration by Government of Maharashtra
In order to deal with issues of interstate nature a national fisheries Consultation has been planned to review the marine fisheries regulations of the coastal states in this regard during 2015 Due to Lok Sabha State Assembly elections during 2014 this workshop could not be conducted as planned
Amendments to MFRA incorporating provisions for the conservation of coastal and marine biodiversity approved or under consideration by State Department of Agriculture Fisheries

The Commissioner of Fisheries Government of Maharashtra has made it mandatory to use square mesh at cod end of Trawl nets
Restriction of vessel size CPUE is under consideration by Government of Maharashtra
In order to deal with issues of interstate nature a national fisheries Consultation has been planned to review the marine fisheries regulations of the coastal states in this regard during 2015 Due to Lok Sabha State Assembly elections during 2014 this workshop could not be conducted as planned

description.narrative: Compliance of existing activities related to tourism fisheries ports mining and agricultural activity in the target landscape with the LP

comment.narrative: There is no comprehensive zoning plan for production activities in the SCME that takes into account conservation needs

By project end an action plan for bringing existing activities related to tourism fisheries ports mining and agricultural activity in line with the LP is developed and approved by sectoral departments

Tourism
i Solid waste management programs initiated at Malvan Nagar Parishad and Kunkeshwar Village Panchayat
ii Sindhudurg Fort has been made Plastic Free
Fisheries
v Fisheries sector plan prepared
vi Acceptance of square mesh at cod end of trawl nets by local fishers community
vii Improvement of fish stock through artificial reef is under implementation
viii Joint patrolling of Sindhudurg by fisheries and Forest Dept being implemented
Agriculture
i SRI has been adopted by 235 farmers
ii System of Rice Intensification SRI Phase 3 has been sanctioned which will cover 1000 Acers of Paddy area and 4000 farmers

By project end an action plan for bringing existing activities related to tourism fisheries ports mining and agricultural activity in line with the LP is developed and approved by sectoral departments

description.narrative: Compliance of new developments related to tourism fisheries ports mining and agricultural activity in the target landscape with the LP

comment.narrative: There is no comprehensive zoning plan for production activities in the SCME that takes into account conservation needs
By project end any new developments related to tourism fisheries ports mining and agricultural activity conform with the LP

Tourism
As the Local District administration has already prepared the District Tourism Plan the activities of the tourism sector under the project has been revised to address the existing gaps in the district tourism plan which includes i Green rating of BB units ii Model for community based tourism of two villages iii Alternate tourism destinations to reduce pressure in Malvan iv Deal with solid waste generation on the beaches by tourists v Anchorage points for boats ferrying tourists to coral areas for snorkeling diving and vi Training of snorkeling guides in safety firstaid marine life interpretation The community based tourism plans of two villages and Green Rating of BB units were prepared by Ms Cultural Aangan and reports in this regard was submitted The same has been taken up with MTDC for implementation Proposals for alternative tourism was sought and the same are being finalized Anchorage point finalization with community and MMB is being initiated
Agriculture
System of Rice Intensification SRI Phase 3 has been sanctioned which will cover 1000 Acers of Paddy area and 4000 farmers
Fisheries
i Fisheries sector plan prepared
ii Acceptance of square mesh at cod end of trawl nets by local fishers community
iii Improvement of fish stock through artificial reef is under implementation
iv Joint patrolling of Sindhudurg by fisheries and Forest Dept being implemented
By project end any new developments related to tourism fisheries ports mining and agricultural activity conform with the LP

System of Rice Intensification SRI Phase 3 has been sanctioned which will cover 1000 Acers of Paddy area and 4000 farmers

iii Improvement of fish stock through artificial reef is under implementation

description.narrative: Recommendations on reform of Wildlife Protection Act

comment.narrative: WPA has a terrestrial focus that is not suited to marine PAs
Amendments that give explicit recognition to marine PAs are approved or under consideration by the MoEF

Government notification is awaited
Proposal sent to Government of Maharashtra for transfer of power to Fisheries Department for enforcing the provisions of the Wild Life Protection Act 1972
Joint patrolling exercise of forest department and fisheries department is being implemented
Amendments that give explicit recognition to marine PAs are approved or under consideration by the MoEF

Government notification is awaited
Proposal sent to Government of Maharashtra for transfer of power to Fisheries Department for enforcing the provisions of the Wild Life Protection Act 1972
Joint patrolling exercise of forest department and fisheries department is being implemented

description.narrative: Community based ecotourism operations as a of all tourism operations in project area

comment.narrative: 50 by project end

Guidelines for ecotourism
Green rating for Bed breakfast units has been prepared
Panchayats with ecotourism potential identified need assessed and following support rendered for 12 Gazebos in 4 villages 16 paddle boats in 2 villages 19 changing room in 6 villages 8 mobile toilets in 3 villages and water harvesting structures for 2 villages
Proposals for alternative tourism potential and community based tourism are being considered for finalization

description.narrative: Reduction elimination of trawlers from outside SCME ie from Ratnagiri Maharashtra Goa and Karnataka

comment.narrative: Baseline to be collected in Year 1
50 reduction of trawlers from outside SCME

National Fisheries Meet of the coastal states is being planned
Joint patrolling of Sindhudurg Coast by Fisheries and Forest Department has been sanctioned and is being implemented
50 reduction of trawlers from outside SCME

National Fisheries Meet of the coastal states is being planned

description.narrative: Number of violations of MMS Management Plan compared with year of initial patrolling

comment.narrative: Baseline violations to be measured in 1st 3 months of project
Declines by 50 by year 5

In view of the prevailing situation relating to nonacceptance of the MMS any compliance in this regard would happen after rationalization of the MMS boundaries and Zoning based on findings of the studies being conducted landscape level planning exercise and consultations with local communities
Declines by 50 by year 5

In view of the prevailing situation relating to nonacceptance of the MMS any compliance in this regard would happen after rationalization of the MMS boundaries and Zoning based on findings of the studies being conducted landscape level planning exercise and consultations with local communities

description.narrative: Incidence of encroachment of intensive fishing operations into traditional fishing grounds

comment.narrative: Encroachment is taking place
By project end all fishing activity complies with zoning specified in LP and there are no reports of encroachment

Joint patrolling of Sindhudurg Coast by Fisheries and Forest Department has been sanctioned and is being implemented
National Fisheries Meet of the coastal states is being planned
By project end all fishing activity complies with zoning specified in LP and there are no reports of encroachment

Joint patrolling of Sindhudurg Coast by Fisheries and Forest Department has been sanctioned and is being implemented

description.narrative: Mesh size laws are followed by the trawlers

comment.narrative: To be collected in the first year
50 of trawlers follow the mesh size norms set up by Mesh Regulation Committee 1983

1Baseline results shows 100 noncompliance of mesh size regulations by the trawlers in Sindhudurg
2Commissioner Fisheries Maharashtra has issued order to make BRJFEDs mandatory on trawlers so that only those who have nets with BRJFEDs are eligible for diesel subsidies 3 The trials on Square mesh net at the cod end of trawl nets have found wide acceptance among trawler owners in Sindhudurg As a result of which under the program 200 trawlers would be provided square mesh net
50 of trawlers follow the mesh size norms set up by Mesh Regulation Committee 1983

1Baseline results shows 100 noncompliance of mesh size regulations by the trawlers in Sindhudurg
2Commissioner Fisheries Maharashtra has issued order to make BRJFEDs mandatory on trawlers so that only those who have nets with BRJFEDs are eligible for diesel subsidies 3 The trials on Square mesh net at the cod end of trawl nets have found wide acceptance among trawler owners in Sindhudurg As a result of which under the program 200 trawlers would be provided square mesh net

description.narrative: Number of skillsdevelopment activities carried out for VLIs and other local institutions for alternative livelihoods or sustainable ecosystembased livelihoods that reduce pressures on biodiversity

comment.narrative: Target to be defined after design of the microplans

Following Skill development program conducted
i Apiculture by Suprakriti Madhusala Nasik 20 bee colonies were setup 24 people including 21 women were trained ii Mangrove Crab farming by MPEDA 223 people were trained
iii A demonstration unit was set up on Mussel Oyster farming by CMFRI 1 community based unit set up during 2014
iv An exclusive program to set up 4 Mussel Oyster farming 19 persons trained v Snorkeling Guide by Science Technology Park Pune 92 guides trained vi System of Rice Intensification demonstrated by Mayem Panlot Sangh 336 farmers undertook the activity
Target to be defined after design of the microplans

description.narrative: To mainstream biodiversity conservation considerations into those production sectors that impact coastal and marine ecosystems of the SCME
Landscapeseascape area in the SCME where production activities mainstream biodiversity conservation

comment.narrative: 0 ha
About 6327 sq km 2327 sq km as area of direct influence and 4000 sq km as area of indirect influence

Recruitment of LP consultant in process microplans of 134 project villages and fisheries plan tourism plan prepared and proposal for MPA in the sea scape of Angria Bank under preparation A project on Solid waste management is under implementation by Malvan Municipal Authorities and Kunkeshwar Village level authorities The Sindhudurg Fort has been declared Plastic Free Turtle nests have been conserved during the nesting period November 2014May 2015 Mangrove Gene Bank project on raising RET species has been sanctioned
About 6327 sq km 2327 sq km as area of direct influence and 4000 sq km as area of indirect influence

Recruitment of LP consultant in process microplans of 134 project villages and fisheries plan tourism plan prepared and proposal for MPA in the sea scape of Angria Bank under preparation A project on Solid waste management is under implementation by Malvan Municipal Authorities and Kunkeshwar Village level authorities The Sindhudurg Fort has been declared Plastic Free Turtle nests have been conserved during the nesting period November 2014May 2015 Mangrove Gene Bank project on raising RET species has been sanctioned

description.narrative: Extent of coral reefs in the project area

comment.narrative: 360 sqkm and this will be verified in first 6 months of the project
The extent of coral cover remains at least stable or increasing

Following achievements made in respect of Coral conservation
1 Studies on Coral and Associated species of Sindhudurg by the Zoological Survey of India i Species recorded Corals14 species Molluscs16 species Echinoderms 3 species Crustaceans 12 sp Polychaetes 3 sp Fishes 38 sp Seaweeds 7 sp
ii Permanent plots marked
iii New genus of Corals viz Pavona bipartita and Goniopora minor have been identified
2 Exploration of Angria Bank approx 100 species have been identified during the first expedition Based on the findings of the study it has been proposed to declare a Marine Reserve in the area covering a submerged plateau of 700 Sq Km
3 Setting up of Artificial Reef and Coral transplantation in an area of 025 Sq km area along Sindhudurg coast has been initiated
The extent of coral cover remains at least stable or increasing

Following achievements made in respect of Coral conservation
1 Studies on Coral and Associated species of Sindhudurg by the Zoological Survey of India i Species recorded Corals14 species Molluscs16 species Echinoderms 3 species Crustaceans 12 sp Polychaetes 3 sp Fishes 38 sp Seaweeds 7 sp
ii Permanent plots marked
iii New genus of Corals viz Pavona bipartita and Goniopora minor have been identified
2 Exploration of Angria Bank approx 100 species have been identified during the first expedition Based on the findings of the study it has been proposed to declare a Marine Reserve in the area covering a submerged plateau of 700 Sq Km
3 Setting up of Artificial Reef and Coral transplantation in an area of 025 Sq km area along Sindhudurg coast has been initiated

description.narrative: Population status of following critical species Olive Ridley turtle and Indopacific hunch back dolphin

comment.narrative: 4050 nesting sites of Olive Ridley Turtles reported and 100150 Indopacific hump back dolphins frequent the region This will be verified in first 6 months of the project
Population status remain at least stable increasing

Onshore Turtle Conservation undertaken and the results of the interventions are summarized as under
Year 201415 Sites conserved 13
Nests conserved 35
Hatchling released 2164
Turtle conservation 108 nests 363834 have been protected during project period from around 16 sites with the active participation of local communities
Project has been awarded to Konkan Cetacean research TeamKCRT The assessment of the research team indicates presence of Indopacific humpback dolphin in the range of 455569 and that of Finless porpoises in the range of 65130
A reporting system for stranding and beaching has been developed
Capacity building program 3 programs 52 individual trained representing departments of fisheries forest port animal husbandry and 3 programs for locals where in 87 person trained
Population status remain at least stable increasing

Onshore Turtle Conservation undertaken and the results of the interventions are summarized as under
Year 201415 Sites conserved 13
Nests conserved 35
Hatchling released 2164
Turtle conservation 108 nests 363834 have been protected during project period from around 16 sites with the active participation of local communities
Project has been awarded to Konkan Cetacean research TeamKCRT The assessment of the research team indicates presence of Indopacific humpback dolphin in the range of 455569 and that of Finless porpoises in the range of 65130
A reporting system for stranding and beaching has been developed
Capacity building program 3 programs 52 individual trained representing departments of fisheries forest port animal husbandry and 3 programs for locals where in 87 person trained
